newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks turn touch higher on U.S. data.
newsitem.headline: French stocks turn touch higher on U.S. data.

text.p: French shares tiptoed into positive ground on the back of U.S. producer prices which showed a rise in the core index figure, excluding food and energy, of 0.1 percent, in line with expectations.
The headline figure showed a 0.5 percent rise, while the market had been looking for a 0.3 percent advance.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index was up 2.45 points or 0.11 percent at 2,334.07 at 1244 GMT while the CAC-40 futures contract was up five at 2,341 from Wednesday's settle.
